title: Safe Tick Removal Technique
brief: How to safely remove attached ticks to prevent disease transmission.
steps: Cover attached tick with substance that cuts off air supply: Vaseline, heavy oil, or tree sap.
Wait for tick to release its hold without air supply.
Use tweezers if available to grasp tick where mouth parts attach to skin.
Do not squeeze the tick's body during removal.
Wash hands thoroughly after touching the tick.
Clean the tick wound daily until healed.
warnings: Do not squeeze tick's body as this can inject more disease-causing organisms
Ensure complete removal - leaving mouth parts can cause infection
Inspect body daily for attached ticks
